Text:
Since I bought some new clothes, I'll get dressed
up and go out!

It is all very well thinking that, but being by
myself is lonely. Oh, if I could, I would go
with my lord.

My lord, what do you think of this dress?
Is it cute?

I let my shoulders show today...maybe too bold? Heheh,
I'm grown up now, so this is normal.

But, my lord, your gaze is so passionate...do you
find something interesting...
...Mama...

Um, I might look like an adult but I am not your
mama.

Well, if my lord said he wanted a baby with me in the
future, I would certainly consider it.
Mamaaa...

Oh, if you suddenly hold my hand I will feel all
awkward...huh? You're going to hold my hand?
Mama.
...Huh?

Looking down, a boy of about 4 years old is tugging
on Epsilon's hand.

H-Hold on a moment, who are you...? Why are you
tugging on my hand like that?!
Mama.

I am not your mama. Go back to your real mama before
you become lost, okay?
I am busy, so I need to get going. Okay? Bye bye!
...He is still staring at me.

Why are you staring at me like that? I told you, I
am not your mama... Argh! I can't leave you alone
like this if you stare at me with those eyes.

Um, are you lost? In this situation...I guess I'll
help you find your mama.
Mama!

Like. I. Said... I am not your mama! I am obviously
too young to be your mama.

What did I do to end up paired with this...3 or 4
 year old child? I am not that old yet!
W-Waah...

Oh, sorry. I am sorry I said that out loud. So don't
cry, okay?

Just walking around without any further information
isn't helping us find your mama.

If he could at least tell me his name... Huh?! Why
are you pulling on my hand...wh-where are you
going?
Oh, did you see your mama?!

The boy was pulling her much harder than she
expected...to a stall in the market.
Ice, ice! Cream! I want!

Whaaa...? We don't have time to eat ice cream!
We need to quickly find your mama—
Waah...ice...
The boy's eyes fill with tears.

Okay! I understand, so don't cry! Auntie Epsilon will
buy ice cream so choose whichever one you like.
Vanilla! Annnd...and...

Huh? One scoop! Just one scoop! You can't eat more
than that, okay?
I can!
...Okay, okay.

Huh...why am I getting this harsh lesson in childcare?
I wanted to go shopping, but instead I am a babysitter...

If I don't find his mama soon I will end up spending
the whole day babysitting.
Juice! Drink juice!

J-Juice...? You haven't finished your ice cream! You
will get a stomach ache if you eat and drink so many
cold things!
*sniffle*

A-Again...? Come on, don't think you can cry as much
as you want just because you are a child!
Waah, waah.... Wwwaaaaaaah!

Oi oi, those kids are fightin' right in the middle of
the street.
Brats out all alone...where're the parents?

As they pass through the crowd, people around them
whisper meanly.

Ugh... If you look at me with those big eyes, I have
to do something. Rather, it makes me want to cry...

(A long time ago...I was lost, like this child. I was
alone, so lonely... But, I was so ashamed about
being lost that I couldn't ask for help...)

(I realized in my loneliness that I was humming a
song. A children's song...one that my own mother
often sang for me when I was little. Even now it
just naturally bursts out of me...)
La, la, la...
This brings back memories.

You look astonished, what is it? Could it be...you
know this song?
Mama sing.

Oh? Actually, Auntie Epsilon's mama also often sang
this song. I had wanted to forget my whole past, or at
least I thought I had, but strangely enough... I can't
forget this song.
Hey, let's sing together.
Yeah!
La, la, la...
Thank goodness! There you are!
Mama...? Mamaaa!

I could hear familiar singing, so I thought maybe...
just maybe...so I came running... Oh, I'm so glad.

Sorry, I was focused on shopping and took my eye off
him just for a moment...I'm so sorry.

You looked after him, right? Thank you! I can't say
thank you enough...

Oh... He came to me rather than me finding him...
Hahaha, you don't need to thank me.
Mama!

Like. I. Said. I am not your mama. Anyway, it is
great that your real mama found us. Don't get
lost again, okay?
Yeah. Mama sing. Together sing!

Watching him wave his tiny hand as he is led away,
Epsilon thinks to herself.

...Yes, it would be nice if we can sing again
together one day.
Feeling lonely?

Beta, what are you doing here... I mean, how long
were you watching?!

Well, Mama Epsilon, maybe from around the time the
two of you were cozying up over ice cream.
Like I said before, I am nobody's mama!

Phew, what a relief to be finally free. Babysitting
really messed up my precious day off!

Okay, time to go shopping before the sun goes down.
Beta, you are coming with me.
What? You can't just decide stuff like that!
